channel.title: Effect of Bin laden's death...?
channel.description:
Alright, so lately at school I've heard alot of racist shit towards Muslims/people of the race..
It's fucked up because Bin laden was an extremist... He claimed to be Muslim but didn't follow the teaching of the Muslim bible or w.e its called ( I forgot )..
He killed more Muslims then any other religions...
Don't you all agree that this is kinda sad?

item.title: Effect of Bin laden's death...?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“i code rsps, post:31, topic:394579”][quote author=R A R E S link=topic=491763.msg3599071#msg3599071 date=1305399863]
To be honest, bin laden could of been an “imaginary threat” to scare people. How i see it is, that if the government can scare the world by saying that the world will end in a specific year, and that all this bad stuff will happen why can’t they make up an imaginary person with an imaginary cause and then when they feel they have intimidated the whole country they decide they spontaneously “found” the threat and killed him. Just a scenario that is possible lol
[/quote]

That’s not possible at all there’s countless pictures and videos of bin laden.[/quote]

It is possible that it was an actor in those videos. Someone to put a face to the “threat”. It’s often been speculated that a war would bring economic prosperity.

Read full topic

It’s not like it ends the war or anything, but his death does mean a lot. Think of what it must feel like to hear this news to those whos family/friends died as a result of what this man did

item.title: Effect of Bin laden's death...?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:16, topic:394579”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=491763.msg3596816#msg3596816 date=1305173109]

“All white people are racist because of the KKK.”

Same thing.

We could say the same about the ‘Black Panthers’, who just recently declared all members to buy from black owned/ran stores only.
[/quote]

Exactly.

Although, I tend to think about “race” as human, because that’s the way it is in video games.[/quote]
To be honest, for each race, religion, or about anywhere one can fit, there is an extremist group that things that specific thing is better than the rest. Its just a natural thing that occurs all over. I’ve learned to get used to it.

@OP - To be honest, I would ignore it. I had to ride the bus with a racist bus-driver for 2 years. Finally I got a car and worked for $20 a day just to have gas money not to ride the bus. I would, at times, walk 15-20 miles home because I didn’t want to deal with the driver some days. At points, I would get a lucky straw and someone pass by and give me a lift (very trust-able area, otherwise this would be a very bad anywhere else). The only thing you can really do is stick it out, or find a solution. Like me and getting a car, it was a solution, although I had to stick it out for 2 years.

Read full topic
